bow: resent my child apologies in advance for the length of this but think backstory and examples are necessary here my son just turned three he is extremely intelligent the psychiatrist we ve been seeing for his issues suggested development testing and he scored highly gifted he may be smart boy but he also has the worst behavior of any three year old child have ever seen some backstory he has been difficult child since birth he was up times per night until he was 14 months old at the age of he still doesn sleep through the night most nights he also had colic and screamed close to hours day for months on end he is sick all the time he will go maybe week without cold symptoms and then be sick for months on end we ve investigated allergies but he has tested negative for everything so far he also has gastrointestinal problems he had borderline diarrhea since starting on solid food we ve tried various elimination diets but nothing has made difference he also has never been able to play happily on his own always requiring someone to be with him entertaining him on great day he ll play on his own happily for five minutes tops he has an incredible impulse control problem he is violent with me his father and the other kids at his daycare the violence is very typically unprovoked for example last week he got out of his cot during nap at daycare picked up shoe and hit another sleeping child in the head according to the staff she and my son had even played together that day he will walk up to me while cooking dinner and hit me with his toys when react in pain he often laughs he has no attention span he can not even maintain eye contact with you when you are trying to talk to him always looking around for other things he can focus on he has no patience and no fuse if something doesn go his way he erupts in anger immediately screaming crying throwing things or hitting whoever happens to be nearby he is also hyperactive he never walks anywhere even in the house he runs and jumps he can not sit still for more than 10 seconds unless we are reading to him and he never shuts his mouth he literally must be talking ever second of every day we never get break he is also not yet potty trained he knows how to use the potty but chooses not to he rather go in his pull ups and then laughs when we have to change them we have tried putting him in underwear but he pees and poops in that too everyday when pick him up from daycare get the damage report how many other children he hurt how many naps he disrupted etc between the potty training the refusal to nap and the violent behavior with other children the daycare is threatening to kick him out and can blame them kick him out too want to be clear do not have unrealistic expectations for my child he three expect certain amount of violence tantrums impulse control problems hyperactivity etc my issue is that he is off the chart on all these things when compared to his peers and we have tried everything to improve his behavior rewards praise negative reinforcement punishment taking toys away timeouts counting… everything we have done exhaustive investigations of his health issues spanning allergy testing dietary changes family doctors specialists psychiatrists counselors… nothing has helped bottom line is because of all these issues have never felt attachment to this child and grow more distant from him after every battle every violent outburst my resentment for him grows resent him because we always wanted to have two kids but there is no way we will have second one after him resent him because he has therefore robbed me of my opportunity to parent normal loving child resent him because he loves his father more than he loves me even when he is the disciplinarian and am not resent him because go to bed each and every day exhausted angry and broken on the verge of an anxiety attack resent him because instead of enjoying time playing with my child dread it because know it will only end in one of us screaming and me with some kind of physical injury so mommit… where do go from here am desperate have tried parental counseling as well as child psychiatry with no help we can not ask for more childcare from my family and can not afford to hire outside babysitting right now need to get these feelings of distance and resentment under control so that can be better parent need to fix his behaviours so that don have mental breakdown thanks to everyone who made it through this monster post ll take any and all advice criticism suggestion :hugs has he been tested for asperger or oppositonal defiant disorder or pervasive developmental disorder not otherwise specified pdd nos have this kid too couple of notes behavior and sleep may improve with age at my guy still sleeps like shit but at least he is sleeping still cry sometimes but is down to every couple of weeks have you had him evaluated by an occupational therapist large part of my son issues are because of sensory processing problems getting through normal day of sights smells and sounds can be agonizing for him you can also have the school district evaluate him for services they may be able to help with diagnosis recommend this can you get 10 hour high school student to babysit couple of hours week can you find support group for special needs parents try care com and meetup com you are not bad mom or bad person for resenting him it is psychological torture to endlessly give with nothing in return but also try to remember he is not being jerk on purpose he is just doing what he can with what he has and it sounds like you need to do little more detective work edit that sounded unsympathetic when reread it know you ve been to million specislists have too but keep trying there is help out there also we had second kid against my better judgment and he is an easy cuddly lovebug no regrets ll type more later if remember on my phone right now thank you for the hugs and suggestions the psychiatrist we ve been seeing stopped short of labelling her word him with anything we have an appointment with another psychiatrist this week to see if second opinion will help in the meantime will do some research on odd do think he has pdd nos because his language skills are off the charts he has the vocabulary of middle school child easily his speech patterns do seem to fit with asperger either nonetheless thank you again for the suggestions do appreciate it wish had solution for you but do my boys are both profoundly gifted and both have adhd and while they can and do routinely test and redefine the limits of my patience my struggles have been the same as yours in my estimation weathering all of what you ve described and still being capable if composing coherent sentence should qualify you for at least two olympic medals not helpful know you ll no doubt catch hell for what you ve said in your post want very much to be wrong but ve seen otherwise too often to expect that even half of the folks who reply will be supportive let it roll off think about flying in an airplane and how the flight attendants always do the preflight safety speech where they tell you to don your own oxygen mask before trying to help any children traveling with you know why because if you keel over because ca breathe you wo be any help to the wee ones what you ve done in posting here is clear demonstration that you grasp that concept very well your son is incredibly fortunate to have mother who takes good care of herself so that she can properly care for him wish you and your family the absolute best deleted oh also highly recommend getting your anxiety depression treated as well it has mafe world of difference in my ability to cope with the little scamp we have seen an ot or considered sensory processing issue will add this to my list of things to check thank you with regard to babysitting funds are very tight as is time my husband and are both in graduate school nearly finished thank god and both work almost full time once the kiddo is in bed our evenings are spent catching up on school work that said it getting to the point where we are going to have to put the dissertations aside for while lest we go completely bonkers you re welcome my son has asperger so get the not making eye contact thing he does that lot also friends with quite few parents of other special needs children because they seem to be the only ones who really get me and what we go through with our son because they ve been there too keep in mind that label is just word it does have to define you or your child it simply word that lets other people doctors school staff etc know how best to help you and your kiddo it ca hurt you if you do let it pdd nos at least the way understand it and somebody will surely correct me if wrong which hey if am go right ahead basically means that there is something going on that not quite right developmentally whether that is speech motor skills wise or behavior wise but they ca put definite finger on what exactly it is you say he has the vocabulary of middle school kid yeah that sounds familiar my son who is talks like he middle aged man half the time and understand the constant talking talking talking oh god do get that mine the same way only he has the tendency to repeat the same word phrase over and over and over until want to scream or he ll watch the same 30 second clip on youtube or from show on netflix like 15 times in row until want to snatch the remote out of his hand :hugs you ll get through this somebody somewhere will be able to put name to what the fuck is going on with your kid and help you figure out how to deal with this shit ve been there know how frustrating it is when you know something wrong but you re not entirely sure what it is yes early intervention services is what meant when said school district can only imagine how hard this must be for you ca think of any useful advice but wanted to write and let you know feel for you hope things work out as he gets little older hugs mine did talk at all until he was four and half then suddenly started busting out with paragraphs and five syllable words thank you very much for you kind words and for the warning will try not to let the negativity get to me honestly do really wish that had addressed my feelings in more direct way earlier have seen parenting counsellor and psychologist but they were unhelpful and gave up also find self care to be incredibly challenging because my husband is going through exactly the same thing it hard to take much needed breaks when your partner is facing the same battles you are thank you so much thanks for the advice tried several session with psychologist cbt and did find it very helpful think should try different person perhaps thanks for the suggestion canadian actually will look at what we have in my province thanks again it is immensely frustrating to know that something is wrong to have no clue what it is and further to not know how to make things any better yea the constant talking especially after bad day makes me want to rip out my hair have to bite my tongue to keep from yelling at him to just be quiet for five minutes any objection to trying medication it can bring relief from anxiety despair pretty quickly it can be short term thing if your anxiety is not chronic problem you do necessarily even need psychiatrist your gp can help is the psychiatrist job to label maybe her hesitation is because he is so young think second opinion is great idea hey ve been down that road when you finally figure out what the hell is going on it ll be huge relief because then you ll know what you need to do to help make things better also keep in mind that your kid is not broken his brain may not be wired like normal kid and he may not act like normal kid but that perfectly alright he not broken he does need to be fixed despite what people like jenny mccarthy will tell you you did do this to him it was complete luck of the draw imo you just have to learn to work around his issues help him learn to deal with them and go on with life because chances are these things are not going to just go away as he gets older this is probably something he ll have to learn to deal with his entire life it seems like you have already gotten some great advice just wanted to say good luck amp truly hope things get better there is no shame in temporarily lightening your load in the meantime try googling sensory gyms in your area you do need diagnosis to spend some time playing at one of those sensory gym was extremely helpful in managing my son behavior did have one wanted to try non pharmacological interventions first ve been getting more exercise going to bed earlier and have vastly improved my diet all those things apparently have positive impact on mental health but have done nothing for me thus far think should go back to my family doc to give her an update maybe it is time to consider medication that was exactly my thought the only thing could think was that he was either too young or that she felt that his behaviour just was severe enough to fit within the diagnostic criteria of something like adhd in her defence think he has gotten much worse since the last time we ve been in we will see what the second psychiatrist says thanks for this it is constant battle for me not to paint him as broken do blame myself for how he is but feel like have to do better at dealing with his challenges and maybe if was better the challenges would lessen have you done much reading on highly gifted children thank you very much have never heard of sensory gyms and it turns out there is one 10 minutes from my home going to try to get him in there the descriptions on the website about determining whether or not your child might benefit from ot fit my son to thank you very much around here they wo diagnose adhd until autism is we have never gotten an official diagnosis for my kid we ve cobbled together theory and treatment plan for sensory processing disorder language disorder and clinical anxiety oh speaking of diagnosis have you looked into seeing developmental pediatrician that would be logical next step yes have an academic so all do is read really know that many gifted kids have behavioural challenges similar to my son there is decent chance that there is any other diagnosis for him but want to rule things out also even when compared to other gifted kids feel like his challenges are extreme one thing we have been struggling with is educational outlets for him either for now or in future the public school system has basically no resources for gifted kids until grade obviously many years off and we can not afford private school or the privately offered enrichment programs the latter of which run several hundred dollars month is there anything in particular you recommend reading am always looking for more resources thanks for the suggestion we have an appointment with our paediatrician on monday and will ask about seeing someone with developmental specialty where am not aware of any age limits for diagnoses like adhd or autism but suppose that could be the case ll look into it sensory processing issue was my immediate thought too this is all great advice and hope it able to get op some help op it sounds like you re so on top of things and are doing an amazing job just know you ll get this figured out and these first few years will be distant exhausting memory you are welcome really feel for you am still scared and sad sometimes but things are much better than they used to be hope they get better for you too thanks for the kind words hope things get better soon and that can look past these years of misery almost asleep so ll dig up some resources tomorrow the only thing can think to mention is that the difference between gifted and profoundly gifted can be just as big as the difference between average and gifted three year old with 125 iq compared to 105 will present different set of parenting challenged compared to kid with iq 125 well 145 is whole other game and 165 is whole other game on whole other *planet* is homeschool an option once you both finish school are there any private schools in your area that specifically work with gifted kids sudbury might work well for him mention it because there are schools that offer generous tuition breaks worth looking into anyway more tomorrow had anxiety depression both pre and post pardum did want to take anything but it came to the point where could function ob put me on cipralex takes few weeks to notice any change low dose and low impact but it made world of difference slowly the last person to take medication for something but highly recommend speaking to your ob or gp about it ca comment to much of what you posted but did want to ask if you re sharing your feelings with his father are you two teamed up know it normal for kids to have favorite parent at different stages of development especially now that he and feeling more like big boy despite the potty training issues that could explain why he gravitating toward his father my daughter has odd and she is your child only would say it gets better but it kinda does it gets different and more manageable caffeine helps my daughter because she also has adhd you could try it worst case scenario is it does work best case it helps if you ever need to vent pm me there too am so sorry for you the only advice have for you if you have already tried it is to try and increase his exercise levels after daycare if you can take him to large park and just let him run around like crazy to tire himself out physically *maybe* he ll be slightly easier to manage back home he clearly does need professional help keep pestering your gp and social services for that and you need some respite care as well in my opinion an approach which can be helpful is to use medication to help in the short term while going to psychologist counselor to build strategies habits to help long term and then gradually stopping the medication also you may find that therapies other than cbt suit you better acceptance and commitment act may be an approach you get more from for example on my phone so ca get into long description but google can tell you more if you re interested good luck and as others have said you re not bad mom sounds like junior needs some good old fashion discipline read an article not long ago where mom was talking about her daughter she sounded like your child violent and hard to control she found out that her child had issues with gluten not celiac or anything just like an allergy when she was off if she was like normal little one but just couple bites and in but she would have to restrain her to protect the other children know it sounds odd but have read that before too not trying to jump on that no wheat bandwagon best of luck with it all do know what would do have friend who gp who does lots of alternative medicine as well he was telling me last time saw him that probiotics can often help colicky babies clearly your son is no longer baby but perhaps it might be worth trying beyond that best wishes to you see you ve got lots of suggestions on this thread and hope something here works out for you just wanted to stop by and say that do think you re bad mom or bad person for feeling the way you do you are seriously stressed and that level of stress can make it hard to bond and feel connected especially with the person that is the source of all that stress when get over stressed my default is so feel very resentful could easily see myself reacting the way you have if was dealing with the same circumstances that you are really do have much advice except for this if you have local ymca they may have babysitting services that go along with family membership this is way for parents to drop off their kids for hours so they can go read in the lounge or go for swim or workout etc if you do have ymca or you already avail yourself of these services just want to let you know that you are heard and do think you re bad person think you re just stuck in very difficult situation had this kid too address the sleep first and foremost ve had friends with highly intelligent boys diagnosed with severe adhd treat their kids sleep issues and have completely different children once they started sleeping soundly highly gifted and sleep deprived year olds are assholes full stop there were things that turned my kid around in order of importance he learned to read part of not being able to sleep and the misbehavior in the day was due to boredom my kid needs information flowing into his brain *all the time* he was fluently reading 20 books day at and it made him happier than he ever been being allowed to read in bed for 30 minutes with flashlight became the *one* bedtime routine that actually helped him wind down we tried everything and he was suddenly able to fall asleep before 11 pm sleeping more than hours at night reading beat sleeping because it made this possible turning and becoming less self centered and more logical hang in there being an asshole at does mean he ll always be jerk but you ll need to figure out what causing the behavior first please research the effects of sleep deficits on preschoolers and see if they re describing your kid think there definite link between intelligence and and trouble sleeping also really resented my kid too but focused on all his good qualities and stressed them and reminded him and me of them *constantly* but really did like the kid until he was now ca imagine ever feeling those feelings toward him he was nuts though and ve mostly forgiven myself for it he my favorite person to hang out with now that he and is completely different kid than he was at love this aspect of mommit read your post and had no idea how to help but there was another reader who had great idea work with behavioural teens who have autism odd adhd etc yes generally they try not to label as young as because there is high chance the child will outgrow certain behaviours or they will be mislabelled really hope you can get some help it sounds like you are doing the best job you can second having him checked for sensory processing disorder check out http www sensory processing disorder com sensory processing disorder checklist html and http www spdfoundation net about sensory processing disorder html would consider if you have not already done so elminating all processed foods any with artificial dyes and added sugar as well as gluten basically just whole foods diet rich in nuts high fat and protein etc it can take up to months for the gluten and what not to be completely out of the system so this may not be an instant fix but it can help if you stick with it it may be worth it to you will also say probiotic can work wonders superstore in the natural aisle refridgerated section where the soy milks are has kids chewable probiotic by renew life it is usually 17 seriously it had seemed to help my daughter she was backed up but would have bowel movement regularly so was unaware but that helped sort some digestive issues out and helped her mood it is also great idea to take probiotic if you had diarrhea or been sick to help balance the gut baacteria since your son has had bowel issues he may do well on one it is not covered by insurance though my daughter has some sensory issues not enough to get diagnosed but use some of the coping mechanisms to help her through we also do no dyes or gluten and this has greatly helped with outbursts she absolutely can not have dyes she gets this crazed wild eye look and just turns into gremlin she is impossible to calm down and it ends in sensory overload meltdown and everyone frazzled she was also is not sleeper getting better with age and was definitely baby that kept you on your toes how you describe your son was basically my nephew at that age he was diagnosed with organic brain disorder adhd impulse control and odd around age at 16 now he is completely different once he started going through puberty as an early teen his behaviour did 180 he is one of the best behaved sensitive teenagers have ever know my sister said that doctors told her that this happens with some kids when the hormones kick in please also know you said parent therapy but any type of family and individual therapy may be beneficial for everyone in your family it can be hard and therapists can give you and your so coping mechanisms to try and help when the days are tough sorry for the second comment but yes you should there are lots of canadian organizations that can help with early intervention am in ontario and used to work for an organization that gave help to parents in situations like yours we would take the child out for several hours week to give parents break hopefully your son is eligible for early intervention it can make such huge difference which province am canadian as well there is early intervention programs here is the catch the faster the diagnosis you get the more help you qualify for but many people are hesitant to diagnose someone this young cause it can be hard to shake the label but also if he gets the wrong diagnosis then he may be getting the wrong treatment have not worked with lot of children besides my nephew but have worked with lot of adults within group homes and day programs some of their behaviours could be challenging so feel for your family have read lots that sometimes food allergies can turn kids into monsters especially gluten and red and yellow dyes you may want to eliminate some things from his diet one at time and see if that works also have crazy wild monkey for daughter age now and was ridiculous she started out crazy from the amount of hard kicks she was constantly giving me in he womb but was especially crazy have heard that terrible and are worse than terrible but few things that worked for her an emotionally calm consequence based discipline you may have already tried this but whenever got worn out annoyed angry she would play off of it so would stay as calm as possible better said than done but make the punishment fit the crime for instance she would run from me at parks towards busy streets so we stopped going she would ask to go to park and for week would tell her just can not handle it when you run from me so no parks for while have to make sure you are safe think the trick for her was to wait until she was calm if warn her of the consequence when she is crazy or energetic she wo care but when she calmly asks for something and refuse it in calm manner it really seeps in also feel like most of my consequences are based on taking care of myself and not letting my child abuse me or hold the power in the relationship yet if am calm love is still communicated also when realized her strengths and talents it becomes easier to like her will always love her but you know sometimes you do like your kids but there are things that she really excels at signed her up for dance she ran around the room like an animal the whole time gave her some blocks she sat for hours working on different designs and constructions she will sit for hours to learn about science especially if it is medical that made me realize that her crazy energy can actually be used for good and not evil and sometimes wonder if she is crazy because she is not mentally and physically challenged enough throughout the day we watch lot of tv so maybe try out few things hear martial arts is especially good for kids with this kind of energy to challenge and satiate your son intense energy then you may be able to appreciate it and not just resent it good luck though my blood pressure still rises whenever think of my daughter terrible when we tried time outs she would destroy things or just scream at us when we spanked her she would just laugh at us and would feel the same distance and resentment when our relationship was nothing but power plays but she got better and so did and hopefully that will happen for you as well just hope you do feel like bad mom or anything because obviously you are trying so hard for your son when it is anything but easy and that is an amazing example of love that think your son will someday understand think you are amazing oh and since you mentioned that you like reading would suggest parenting with love and logic that method of parenting discipline is the one that worked the best on my daughter it basically what was describing but it nice to hear read more examples and ideas edit one more thing another daughter of mine has gluten intolerance it is super hard to diagnose but it stunts her growth weakens her immune system and gives her daily diarrhea so know you tried eliminating things but you may want to look into gluten again just in case they are still doing research on it so some new things are discovered all the time it weird one but when was little was pretty bad problems did start popping up until preschool but was difficult would climb up the swing while others tried to go down when kids took off shoes for merri go rounds would throw them off the playground was emotional hyper anyway my parents got me tested for depression as soon as was in treatment for that and was super young everything sort of cleared up maybe that problem for him though he is younger than was but more importantly do be too hard on yourself think you are feeling perfectly natural things reading your story think would react in much the same way just try to live day to day and hope that he grows out of it if not know many moms who had one child then ten or fifteen years later had another one that always something to try oh hang in there you are so clearly caring involved very committed mom you can get through this my son is and while he has not had so many of the struggles you are describing am betting you are looking for any and all ideas so here few that came to mind for me take care of yourself it important and it so urgent you can not be your best and feel good if you are consider it health emergency tell your dh that and find way you are worth it step one get more sleep is it possible to fine even one thing day you guys can do that is just fun that wo end badly something that you can enjoy that can be nice memory more of those will push some of the negative ones out of the way maybe just take break from him can you can your husband take some vacation time maybe you just need to be around each other less for while that is totally ok you did say if you work or if hubs does or both but at my house my husband works do and he gets greeted like hero every night lucky him he did have to do battle all day it would be great if daddy can take turn frankly it seems like you are at emergency level maybe you just have to tell him he has to find way my son has been sick 14 times in the last 12 months or so feel you on the constant illnesses ds are fevers and nausea for week hot lethargic and wo eat he is in the bottom weight category officially underweight the sicknesses are killing me but have had three docs say that it just his age and some kids get runny noses others have fevers do have solution on this one but feel your pain it is wearing me down and really putting strain on me and husband we ca always agree on what to do have really strong memory of tucking my son in bed one night at the end of tough day that involved time outs and having to fix mistake he made erasing pencil on walls the strangest thing happened asked him about his day and he smiled and said he had really good day and told him was proud he fixed his mistake and he smiled such contented smile and honestly think he felt safe and content he had seen so much evidence of the rules around him and he had met the challenge when you commented about your son loving daddy even though he the disciplinarian this just came to mind the old saying that kids need discipline and consistent discipline and when they have it they feel safe and happier not to imply that think you are doing it sounds like you have tried everything but just wondering if very smart child needs an even more hardlined approach for longer time can you go back to some of the discipline techniques and try them again for even longer he sounds very very smart and like he is testing you at every turn every turn you must be so exhausted what about starting small with one behaviour and one discipline technique and just keep it going pick one thing that you are going to have absolutely zero tolerance for like running in the house every time he runs you pick him up and put him in time out no discussion just you are running it is not allowed so you must sit in timeout and you just do it every single time it will be tiring but he going to get so tired of having his playing interrupted he got to give up and he will respect you and get it that you are not going to budge and not going to ever make an exception once you conquer that one then pick the next one hitting with toys maybe our rule is if you hit with toy or throw toy the toy is taken away immediately no discussion and put at the top of the tall bookshelf and there have been many tears but that the rule what like about this is do have to get mad just enforce the rule and go back to what am doing with the discipline since he so smart maybe pick techniques that get him to do something because he wants to he does want to lose the toy or he does want to have his play interrupted those are nice things he loses maybe that would work more than things that are bad my yr old has already shown me that she is willing to get spanked just so she can kick me one more time the minute saw the look in her eye that said yeah it was so bad just stopped spanking she ll take the pain in order to do what she wants look really hard for things he is doing well and praise him for them just bit more positive energy may be good thing would also make it clear you respect yourself and he must respect you too if he is trying to hurt or anger you you can step away and say to him can not help you if you are being disrespectful or hurting me or whatever and just remove yourself from the situation even if it is just stepping back few feet and stopping what you are doing wish you so much good luck and also strength you are bigger smarter and in charge believe in yourself edit got to seem more of your answers after posting this having read more of your background and some of these exchanges wonder if it would be useful intellectual exercise to just think what answers would look for if knew for certain that he has no medical problems either physical physical health or mental health yes he is very smart but other than that nothing no allergies no ot problems no sensory overload nothing could anything else explain all of this behaviour do know what conclusion you may come to but it might be liberating and very helpful and while completely agree that as parent you can not stop looking until you find an answer it also seems to me as one small opinion that you have seen lot of specialists am almost afraid to type that do not want to seem unsupportive but as an off the wall type often rely on my husband to tell me when have gotten too intense and zealous about something and since you are looking for any and all ideas feel like this one should be in the mix edit how much is your husband involved in the search for answers what does he think have also had some humbling experiences when was convinced was the only one who could fix it and was basically beating dead horse working on the wrong problem and solution in my case breast feeding was not working and my son was underweight and ignoring what my husband thought and was even mad at my husband for his wrong offensive opinion but somehow managed to step back and get second opinion and my husband was right 100 totally right but was so convinced was going to solve it and could figure it out and was not wrong well yeah was wrong wrong wrong wrong have no advice to offer but do want to send you many hugs you are great mom and he is very very lucky have read the comments yet so wo make my own reply if find similar enough post below but just wanted to comment and give you **a big big big big big big hug** because have had this child too and it *very exhausting* **big hug** thank you for sharing your story it took courage to do that as special education teacher and mother of child on the autism spectrum have some idea of what you re going through many therapists will resist labeling kid that young keep pushing and advocating for your child your local public school system has many free resources request testing from the special education department at your local school district they will do free multi disciplinary evaluation ot pt speech language and iq this is federal law by the way and applicable in all 50 states if you are in texas there great resource called any baby can sent you pm do have any advice but my heart goes out to you the being raised by my great grandparents tells me to tell you beat his ass couple of times set boundaries and make him do certain things at three if he is potty trained and he shits on himself he either cleans himself or he sits in it sometimes you have to do things that go against what you think or want to do now know that an ass whooping is for every child have four of my own and when pop on the butt worked for one time out worked for the other you have to explore ways of discipline and the way it sounds there is any in the house you let him run amuck because you ca handle not being mean here there are days ca handle mine but you are burning the candle at both ends and its going to bite you in the butt eventually he needs to be tested for everything rad odd pdd nos add adhd etc if his behaviors are to the extreme that you say they are he needs to be medicated do believe in medicating children but sometimes it is necessary in order to figure out how to handle things then take the child off of them when he is in better control of his actions do resent him it will only hurt you and him in the end embrace him for who he is and help him help himself there are many good suggestions here to follow up on ll just add this one even though it will be down voted spank every time he hurts you or is violent at home spank him he is strong willed you need to be stronger do it now because he is only going to get bigger and harder to control children need their parents to be in charge sometimes spanking is the only way to do that spanking might initially make him behave worse because he will be outraged keep it up he needs to learn his place in the family just like wolves do in pack not all children respond to sweet reasoning time outs and loss of privileges thank you thanks very much good luck with your daughter hope things get easier for you too not familiar with act will read up on that today thanks in bc ve done some looking and ca quite figure out how early intervention services work here or how we would qualify will continue to research thanks thanks for the suggestion interestingly we had him tested for celiacs because of the gi issues and because it runs in my family test was negative is there way to test for intolerance other than an elimination diet definitely willing to give anything try at this point is there public health office where they have some nurses on hand maybe where they did baby weigh and sees after being born or where they give vaccines usually there is dental hygienist on hand offering free teeth checks as well those places usually problem know how incredibly difficult some children with developmental and psychiatric issues can be work with boy who parents had to put him in treatment home where work at the age of as he was so balls they have prickles weighted blankets deep pressure massage am always shocked when working with special needs kids how much this can reduce aggression also really hope you get some community help not in sync on how to handle an illness or issue deal with that stress lot that huge one in the plus column good luck with everything piggybacking on this comment to second the recommendation for probiotics they were life changing for my son especially since you mentioned that your son has been ill lot has he taken lot of antibiotics in the past those will kill both good and bad bacteria high quality probiotic can make all the difference in the world in getting your son gut healthy again we have also completely eliminated gluten from my little guy diet and he has dramatically improved over the last few months it can be difficult but if you decide to go that route you need to do it 110 even little cheat can undo all the progress that you ve made we had whoops last month where my son accidentally had some gluten and it took 10 days to get him back to normal he was right back to his old self bouncing off the walls screaming night wakings etc it could take weeks to see an improvement but seriously it is so worth it my son is different person real person now just curious is soy part of his diet at all and if so has he been tested for an allergy with it my boyfriend year old kept coming home from his mother sick fever diarrhea runny nose asthma like symptoms it went on for almost year until he came home with brown liquid in his cup she had been giving some type of soy milk because she is lactose intolerant the symptoms to soy allergies matched his and once she stopped giving him the milk he stopped being sick my friend was 28 before she found out she was allergic to soy they put her on an elimination diet to finally find out what was causing lot of problems and they made her start with just soy which put her straight into hospital bed many problems solved suddenly after that it certainly seems to be an allergy that most people are aware can exist and doctors for that matter since it went unrecognised for so long and found only by chance agree witht he medication that violent behaviour needs to stop asap and if it means drugging your child until you can figure it out then so be it some semblance of sanity has to be clung to deleted good question he does get any soy because we determine earlier that he is allergic we took him off dairy to test for lactose intolerance and discovered that soy made his gi problems exponentially worse did affect his behaviour though thanks for the thought sorry to hear that you are on the same page with your partner that must be really rough am very thankful that my husband and are on the same page truly grateful for everything he does for every single time he takes over parenting responsibilities because just ca take it anymore despite the fact that he also miserable he is awesome and am very lucky our will look for again her doctor told her do do month off gluten every speck of it and then month on if there any possible changes to do it again to make sure it was fluke know it is huge lifestyle specific to year olds but loved the parenting with love and logic for teens there were lots of example conversations also do think it is important to *hide* your feelings from your son it is just important not to *act* on them when kids figure out that they can make an adult lose it they do getting mom mad and having her act calmly is nearly as fun exciting empowering as getting her mad and having her yell and scream so you may not be hiding your feelings but think you re doing great when he asks why are you using your quiet voice think it fine to tell him that you are upset tired grouchy disappointed but you do like to yell also for both your sanity is there something you guys can all do together where your son will have hard time getting in trouble can you take him to an empty park can you go hiking in state park when our relationship with our older kids gets tense for long time happy afternoon seems to help re boot the relationship and remind us why we love each other have no advice for you all can offer is hang in there was this year old was horrible my mother said she used to wish hope you have child just like you someday on me secretly we joke about it now as we are very good friends but was not easy to raise not even little was on every psychiatric drug imaginable and it did little to curb my behavior issues eventually just grew the fuck up so there is light at the end of the tunnel one thing must add though that is so important is love even though was violent loud inappropriate rude back talking hyper active chatty talented artistic smart as whip kid my mother loved me even though made her cry with frustration she was always kind and loved me unconditionally am certain it was her love that made me the kind person am today you can do this it not easy and sorry you re having to raise kid like me but there is hope promise thank you so much for this truly needed it
